ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel like my writing has been measurably strengthened over the course of this class. It served well to help me adjust to the college norms of writing papers, and helped me ground myself within the university's libraries and other research resources. I appreciated that the focus of the class was on process more than product, and I felt I was able to develop not only my writing, but also my habits around writing.
I learned how to better organize my writing to support my argument.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course does a great job of developing writing and research skills through the lens of a specific and interesting topic. Translation is of particular interest to me, and has played a relevant role throughout my life, so I found the readings and topics of discussion very engaging. I enjoyed the mix of class sessions that were purely student-discussion based and ones that were more exercise and workshop based. I did find some trouble navigating the schedule for readings, as it was changed once or twice throughout the semester, and paper copies of the new schedule were handed out but the digital schedule on canvas was not updated.

For this course, I was highly engaged with the texts/assigned readings and our subsequent discussions of them. The feedback designed to be part of the paper assignments were thorough and helpful in improving my writing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would. I like that the ENGL 114 sections are based around particular topics of interest, so I would recommend the class to students who are especially interested in translation. I have heard differing opinions about other sections of ENGL 114, but I can heartily recommend the translation section both based on instructor and content.

I would recommend this course to another student looking to improve their writing and receive detailed feedback. Bonus if they're interested in translation, as this course's readings stayed true to the topic indicated by the title of the course.
